page.title: 01Morinsh side of Ben Rinnes
page.content:
This block consists almost entirely of SW shoulders of Ben Rinnes (840mtrs)
with the Hill of Knocknashalg as its main feature There is no industry and the rocky heather ground contains grouse and a few pairs of Ptarmigan. However the grouse population has seriously declined and many resons are given,poor heather for feeding,due to bad burning of heather, increase in vermin and in the tick population. One disturbing feature is a bulldozed track which leads from GlenRivers to the plateu of Ben Rinnes It is a blot and a scar on the landscape and should never have been allowed, why are these hill roads allowed to be made without any planning permission.
